actor_awards.notes: Despite being one of Hollywood's biggest box office draws, Power was famously never nominated for an Academy Award.

filmography.title: Lloyd's of London
filmography.role_description: A young man in 19th-century England who helps build the famous insurance firm; the role that catapulted Power to stardom.
filmography.plot: A childhood friendship between a young boy and Horatio Nelson shapes the history of the British Empire and the Lloyd's insurance syndicate.

filmography.title: In Old Chicago
filmography.role_description: A charming scoundrel who opens a saloon in Chicago, engaging in political corruption before the Great Fire destroys the city.
filmography.plot: Two brothers, one a rogue and the other a lawyer, find their lives torn apart by the Great Chicago Fire of 1871.

filmography.title: Alexander's Ragtime Band
filmography.role_description: An aspiring classical violinist who scandalizes his family by forming a jazz band, leading to a turbulent career and romance.
filmography.plot: A classical violinist rebels against his family to lead a ragtime band, spanning several decades of American music history.

filmography.title: Marie Antoinette
filmography.role_description: The Swedish count who becomes the devoted lover and champion of the French Queen amidst the turmoil of the Revolution.
filmography.plot: The life of Marie Antoinette from her betrothal to Louis XVI to her execution during the French Revolution.

filmography.title: Suez
filmography.role_description: The visionary French diplomat who dreams of building the Suez Canal, facing political intrigue and personal sacrifice.
filmography.plot: Ferdinand de Lesseps pursues his dream of building a canal through the Egyptian desert to link the Mediterranean and Red Seas.

filmography.title: Jesse James
filmography.role_description: The legendary outlaw portrayed as a sympathetic figure driven to crime by railroad tycoons threatening his family's land.
filmography.plot: After railroad agents kill their mother, Jesse and Frank James turn to banditry to exact revenge on the company.

filmography.title: The Rains Came
filmography.role_description: A dignified Indian doctor who dedicates his life to his people, attracting the attention of a wealthy Englishwoman.
filmography.plot: A major earthquake and flood in India bring together a diverse group of people, including a dissolute Englishwoman and an Indian doctor.

filmography.title: Johnny Apollo
filmography.role_description: A college student who turns to a life of crime to pay for his embezzler father's legal defense.
filmography.plot: A son turns to crime to help his father, a convicted embezzler, get out of prison, but ends up in jail himself.

filmography.title: The Mark of Zorro
filmography.role_description: An aristocrat who poses as a fop by day and a masked vigilante by night to fight tyranny in old California.
filmography.plot: A young Spanish aristocrat masquerades as a fop to conceal his identity as a masked vigilante fighting for the people.

filmography.title: Blood and Sand
filmography.role_description: An illiterate peasant who rises to fame as a matador, only to be torn between his loyal wife and a seductive aristocrat.
filmography.plot: An illiterate peasant rises to fame as a matador, but his passion for a beautiful aristocrat threatens his marriage and career.

filmography.title: A Yank in the R.A.F.
filmography.role_description: A cocky American pilot who joins the Royal Air Force to impress an old girlfriend and sees action in WWII.
filmography.plot: An American pilot joins the RAF to be near his former girlfriend, a chorus girl in London during the Blitz.

filmography.title: Son of Fury: The Story of Benjamin Blake
filmography.role_description: A wronged heir who flees to the South Seas to make his fortune before returning to England to claim his birthright.
filmography.plot: A young man fights to reclaim his rightful inheritance from his scheming uncle in 18th-century England.

filmography.title: This Above All
filmography.role_description: A disillusioned British soldier who deserts the army during WWII but finds redemption through love.
filmography.plot: During the Blitz, a young woman joins the WAAF and falls in love with a disillusioned deserter who is hiding from his duty.

filmography.title: The Black Swan
filmography.role_description: A dashing pirate who agrees to help the former pirate Henry Morgan hunt down renegade buccaneers in the Caribbean.
filmography.plot: A reformed pirate helps the governor of Jamaica rid the Caribbean of the buccaneers who refuse to give up their trade.

filmography.title: Crash Dive
filmography.role_description: A PT boat commander who transfers to submarines and clashes with his executive officer over a woman.
filmography.plot: A submarine lieutenant and his commander fall for the same woman against the backdrop of commando raids in the North Atlantic.

filmography.title: The Razor's Edge
filmography.role_description: A World War I veteran who rejects wealth and social status to travel the world in search of spiritual enlightenment.
filmography.plot: A traumatized pilot seeks the meaning of life after WWI, rejecting his wealthy fiancée's world for a spiritual journey.

filmography.title: Nightmare Alley
filmography.role_description: An ambitious carnival barker who rises to fame as a mentalist by exploiting people, only to suffer a harrowing downfall.
filmography.plot: A con man rises from a carnival barker to a society mentalist, but his greed and deception lead him down a dark path.

filmography.title: Captain from Castile
filmography.role_description: A young Spanish nobleman who flees the Inquisition and joins Hernán Cortés on his expedition to Mexico.
filmography.plot: A young Spanish officer fleeing the Inquisition joins Cortez's expedition to the New World.

filmography.title: The Luck of the Irish
filmography.role_description: A reporter who meets a leprechaun in Ireland and finds his life in New York turned upside down by the magical creature.
filmography.plot: A political reporter tries to choose between a wealthy job and his own integrity, helped by a leprechaun he met in Ireland.

filmography.title: Prince of Foxes
filmography.role_description: A cunning artist and spy for Cesare Borgia who undergoes a moral transformation when he is sent to conquer a noble duchy.
filmography.plot: A Renaissance adventurer is sent by Cesare Borgia to manipulate a dukedom into marriage but has a change of heart.

filmography.title: The Black Rose
filmography.role_description: A 13th-century Saxon nobleman who travels to the Far East and serves the Mongol warlord Bayan.
filmography.plot: A Saxon scholar travels to China during the time of the Mongol invasions and falls for a captive English girl.

filmography.title: Rawhide
filmography.role_description: A stagecoach station assistant who is held hostage along with a woman and child by desperate outlaws.
filmography.plot: An assistant at a remote stagecoach station and a stranded woman are held hostage by four outlaws intending to rob the next gold shipment.

filmography.title: The Mississippi Gambler
filmography.role_description: An honorable riverboat gambler who dreams of opening a floating casino while navigating feuds and romance.
filmography.plot: A gambler tries to establish an honest reputation and a gambling business in New Orleans, but faces romantic and professional rivals.

filmography.title: The Long Gray Line
filmography.role_description: An Irish immigrant who spends 50 years at West Point, rising from waiter to athletic trainer and mentor to generations of cadets.
filmography.plot: The biography of Martin Maher, who came to West Point as a waiter and stayed for 50 years, becoming a beloved instructor.

filmography.title: The Eddy Duchin Story
filmography.role_description: The popular society pianist and bandleader whose life is marked by professional success and personal tragedy.
filmography.plot: The life story of the famous pianist and bandleader who captivated New York society in the 1930s.

filmography.title: The Sun Also Rises
filmography.role_description: An American journalist rendered impotent by a war wound, wandering aimlessly through Europe with the 'Lost Generation'.
filmography.plot: A group of disillusioned American expatriate writers live a dissolute, hedonistic lifestyle in France and Spain in the 1920s.

filmography.title: Witness for the Prosecution
filmography.role_description: A charming, affable man accused of murdering a wealthy widow, who vehemently protests his innocence; Power's final completed film.
filmography.plot: A veteran British barrister must defend his client in a murder trial that has surprise after surprise.
